sn9.7:1.1: At one time Venerable Nāgadatta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.7:1.2: Now at that time Venerable Nāgadatta had been entering the village too early and returning late in the day.
sn9.7:1.3: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Nāgadatta, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
sn9.7:2.2: and returning after spending too much of the day,
sn9.7:3.1: I’m afraid for Nāgadatta; he’s so reckless
sn9.7:3.3: May he not come under the King of Death’s power,
sn9.7:3.4: under the sway of the terminator!”
sn9.7:4.1: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Nāgadatta was struck with a sense of urgency.
